SALESFORCE HELP

VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
SEO: Enhance Your Global Search Strategy

Align your storefront with more search engine guidelines, further reduce content cloaking, and include more search-optimized data with only a few clicks. Add visibility for all the locales your storefront supports, and let search engine bots easily crawl and index locale-specific content. Serve more semantic content directly to search engine bots, or customize the bot-enabled pages to suit your specific requirements.

Include Locale in Canonical URLs
To support search engine bots crawling and indexing your multilingual storefront, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now includes the storefront guest user's locale in canonical URLs. The guest user's locale corresponds to a search engine bot's locale. This change helps search engines understand the authoritative version of your storefront content, even when you support multiple regions and languages.
Add SEO Support for All Regions and Languages
Make it easier for search engine bots to crawl and index your localized Home page, Product List page, and Product Detail page. B2B Commerce for Visualforce now complements the default-locale canonical link in a page’s <head> with locale-specific alternate links. With this change, search engines can show your localized page content in search results for the languages and regions your storefront supports.
Serve Home Page Content to Search Engine Bots More Efficiently
To make it easier for search engine bots to crawl and index your Home page, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now serves a bot-enabled Home page. Also, the Home page canonical URL is simplified. These changes improve the efficiency of search engine bots crawling your storefront, which ultimately helps boost your storefront's search ranking.
Include Promotions Content in Bot-Enabled Pages
Include more valuable content in storefront pages served directly to search engine bots, and help elevate the search ranking of your pages. B2B Commerce for Visualforce now includes images for all promotion types and valid promotion locations on the bot-enabled Home, Product List, and Product Detail pages.
Control the Specific HTML Served for Bot-Enabled Pages and Components
Fine-tune the HTML output of the searchable content served directly to search engine bots that are crawling your storefront pages. You can create your own Visualforce pages and components for serving bot-enabled content, and override the default bot-enabled pages and components that B2B Commerce for Visualforce provides. Ensure that search engines crawl the exact semantic content that you want them to see.
Provide Cleaner URLs with Fewer Parameters
To reduce the number of URL variations that search engine bots encounter on your storefront, B2B Commerce for Visualforce now removes certain parameters from page URLs. This change improves the efficiency of bots crawling links on your storefront and simplifies the browsing experience for human users.
Deliver Better Semantic Tagging on the Product List Page
Boost the search ranking of your Product List page showing category results in external search results. The Product List page now contains the correct semantic hierarchy of heading tags. This change helps increase the authority of the page and allows search engine bots to more accurately crawl the content on the bot-enabled Product List page.
Sort Results on the Bot-Enabled and Standard Product List Page by the Same Criteria
Reduce the potential for content cloaking, which can affect your storefront's search ranking. The bot-enabled Product List page now sorts products by the same default criteria that you specify for sorting results on the standard Product List page. With this change, human users and search engine bots experience the same content, which better aligns with search engine guidelines.

title: Enhancing Search Engine Optimization for Your Storefront
